instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 00165 Issue
threads.message:
So I have a problem with a 00165 no display/bklt

Indeed no display...
Indeed no bklt...
CPU is warm
The following will be obvious if there is fan and there is warmth on CPU
BUT:
PPBUS-Fine
PPBUS S5 HS Comp-8.57v
PPDCIN G3H-20.35v
PP3V42 G3H-3.42
pp5vs5-s5.13v
pp5v-s0-5.13
pp3v3 s5-s0: 3.3v
LP8550- New (last ditch effort)
0 volts all up J8300
Any ideas?

threads.title: 00165 Issue
threads.message:
So missing backlight and no image for sure too?
Check first if board properly boots at least.
Do you get chime?
Confirm USB activity; use OSX pendrive with LED link, is better test.
Check J8300 voltage at pins 14, 15, 16, 18/19.

threads.title: 00165 Issue
threads.message:
Missing BKLT and IMAGE- Affirmative
No chime
Yes USB Activity
0 volts anywhere on J8300.
No external display either.

threads.title: 00165 Issue
threads.message:
Check J8300 voltage in the first few seconds when board starts.
Pins 18/19 should get voltage even without LCD connected, at least 2-3s when boots...

threads.title: 00165 Issue
threads.message: No pulse of any kind. I also checked for shorts... on 18,19 and 3,4 with RTG of .6

threads.title: 00165 Issue
threads.message:
Any history available?
Someone else worked on it before?
Disconnect LCD and try external video.
Be sure there is USB activity.
Chime should come on too; try PRAM reset.
